item.title: Get Up To 18 Steam Games For As Low As $2.85 Each With Fanatical's Latest Bundle
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/get-up-to-18-steam-games-for-as-low-as-2-85-each-with-fanaticals-latest-bundle/1100-6531270/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fanatical's Platinum Collection for May 2025 is now live, giving you a chance to pick up a bundle of PC games for as little as $2.85 each. You’ll get to build your own bundle by picking from a catalog of 18 titles, and the more you pick the more you’ll save. As a bonus, Fanatical will toss in a 5% off voucher for your next purchase. All games are offered as official Steam keys.

Cashing in on the offer is simple. Buy three or more games and they’ll cost $3.33 each, five or more for $3.00 each, or seven or more for $2.85 each. Prices will automatically adjust as you add more to your cart. There's no limit to how many you can add, and if you pick all 18, you'll pay just $51.30, which is a huge savings compared to the full bundle's $385 value.

As for the games available, The Forgotten City is one of the most compelling options. Released in 2021, the story-rich RPG has you rewinding time and attempting to figure out who destroyed an ancient city in the Roman Empire. Combat is one way to get your answers, but it’s often a better choice to charm, bribe, or interrogate your subjects. There’s no one way to navigate its challenges, making it excellent for multiple playthroughs.

Faith: The Unholy Trinity has earned Overwhelming Positive reviews on Steam, and it’s an easy recommendation as part of this bundle. With minimalist, retro graphics and a chilling story about demonic possession, it’s a great addition to any Steam library. Inspired by classic 8-bit games and the Satanic Panic of the 1980s, horror fans will find much to love about this unsettling adventure.

Other notable games include the roguelike boomershooter Ziggurat 2, the puzzle-platformer Deliver Us Mars, and the hilarious Yellow Taxi Goes Vroom. You could also check out Teslagrad Remastered and Teslagrad 2 with the Double Pack. The metroidvanias earned impressive reviews, thanks to vibrant graphics, heaps of unlockable skills, and surprisingly nuanced storylines. You'll find the full list of games available in Fanatical's May 2025 Platinum Collection outlined below and on the bundle Fanatical store page.

Platinum Collection (May 2025)

  • 63 Days
  • Aaero Complete Collection
  • Beyond Galaxyland
  • Deliver Us Mars
  • Desecrators
  • Faith: The Unholy Trinity
  • Hammerwatch Anniversary Edition & Hammerwatch II Double Pack
  • Lego Bricktales
  • Megaloot
  • New Star GP
  • Revenge of the Mage
  • Teslagrad Remastered & Teslagrad 2 Double Pack
  • The Foretold: Westmark Legacy
  • The Forgotten City
  • The Haunting of Joni Evers
  • Yellow Taxi Goes Vroom
  • Zero Protocol
  • Ziggurat 2

If you're looking for more savings, plenty of other bundles are available at Fanatical right now, including one that lets you snag a bunch of Bethesda games for $3 a piece. This includes Morrowind: GOTY Edition, Oblivion: GOTY Edition, and The Elder Scrolls Online--so if you're seeking an affordable alternative to Oblivion Remastered, this is definitely worth a closer look.

item.title: Halo Infinite Is Adding One Of Halo's Most Absurd And Incredible-Looking Guns To Date
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/halo-infinite-is-adding-one-of-halos-most-absurd-and-incredible-looking-guns-to-date/1100-6531297/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Microsoft has announced the next big update for Halo Infinite, and it introduces one of the more absurd and over-the-top weapons we've ever seen in Halo's history.

Say hello to the Mutilator, a new brute force weapon featuring a double-barrel shotgun with a Gravity Hammer attached to the end of it. The gun shoots one shell at a time or players can leverage the alt-fire option to shoot two rounds at once. As for the Gravity Hammer element of the gun, Microsoft said, "If there's anything left to devastate, the hammer should finish the job." You can see the new weapon in action in this Halo Infinite video, beginning at 46:50. It looks pretty devastating.

Microsoft created a dedicated mode to highlight the Mutilator, and it's called Mutilator Madness. It's a variant of the Juggernaut mode where a team of players square off against one super-powerful player.

Additionally, Microsoft is adding the Mutilator to regular Halo Infinite maps as a power weapon. Players can also use the weapon in custom matches and in Forge mode.

The Mutilator is coming to Halo Infinite on May 6 as part of the game's upcoming Operation: Last Stand update. The update also incudes a 20-tier free Operation Pass that allows players to unlock a variety of new cosmetics, while a paid 50-tier Premium Operation Pass will be available with even more content.

The Weapons Bench is getting updated, too, allowing players to apply weapon coatings, emblems, charms, and death effects to a variety of weapons. What's more, the Last Stand update brings back bouncing bullets so that projectiles from the S7 sniper rifle and the Flexfire sniper rifle will ricochet off hard surfaces, making the battlefield even more dangerous.

Additionally, the Last Stand update has nerfed the Banshee vehicle by raising the cooldown time for its fuel rod cannon and slowing down the velocity of its projectiles. "We hope these nudges will ensure a more balanced experience for all players. Ramming speed remains unchanged," Microsoft said.

Beyond ongoing updates for Halo Infinite, Microsoft is developing all-new Halo games using the Unreal Engine 5. It's still early days, however, and no new Halo games have been official announced as of yet.

item.title: TMNT: Splintered Fate Collector's Edition Is Packaged In A Pizza Box
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-splintered-fate-collectors-deluxe-edition-amazon-preorder/1100-6531228/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Splintered Fate is getting a pair of physical editions on August 26: a $40 Deluxe Edition that comes with foil trading cards and a $100 Collector's Edition with a pizza box storage case loaded with cool extras. Preorders for both physical editions are available now at Amazon for PS5, PS4, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox.

TMNT: Splintered Fate originally released as an Apple Arcade exclusive in May 2023 before being ported to PC and Switch last summer. PlayStation and Xbox editions will be available digitally on May 20 and June 24, respectively. The Deluxe and Collector's Editions will bring Splintered Fate to physical format for the first time.

TMNT: Splintered Fate - Deluxe Edition

$40 | Releases August 26

Available for PS5, PS4, Switch, and Xbox, the Deluxe Edition includes the base game plus a bunch of extras. For one, you’ll get a physical pack of 10 foil trading cards featuring familiar faces like Leonardo, Donatello, Raphael, and Michelangelo. It also comes bundled with the Casey Jones DLC that adds the hockey-stick-wielding vigilante as a playable character, along with new enemies, bosses, and other additional content.

The Deluxe Edition will get you access to a future, currently unannounced DLC pack. Considering this version of the game is only $40 (compared to $30 for the base game), that’s a pretty impressive list of additional goodies.

TMNT: Splintered Fate - Pipin' Hot Collector's Edition

$100 | Releases August 26

Splintered Fate's Pipin' Hot Collector's Edition includes a bunch of additional extras. Considering its $100 price, this is one of the most jam-packed collector's editions we've seen in quite some time. The Pipin' Hot Collector's Edition is packaged in a slipcased pizza box. Here's everything you get:

  • Pizza Box storage case with slipcase
  • Mutant Ooze Green Tabletop RPG Dice
  • NYC Sewer Manhole Cover Dice Box
  • 50-page Art Book & Retro Manual
  • Foil Trading Card Pack (10 Cards)
  • Double-sided Metallic Coin
  • Splintered Fate Comic Book by IDW Publishing
  • 2 Exclusive Posters of Turtles & Casey Jones
  • Physical copy of TMNT: Splintered Fate
  • Casey Jones & The Junkyard Jam expansion

The Collector's Edition is available to preorder on PS5, PS4, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox for $100 at Amazon.

Our Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Splintered Fate review gave the side-scrolling a brawler a solid 7/10, praising it for fast roguelite action and fun cooperative gameplay modes. Since then, the game has been patched and updated, and the new physical release will enjoy all those improvements right out of the box.

TMNT has seen a bunch of cool merch released over the years, so if you’re looking to add some more Ninja Turtles flair to your home. If you're into classic board games and card games, you can grab TMNT-themed versions of Hungry Hungry Hippos and UNO, while anyone looking to enjoy the mutant quartet's adventures can grab the IDW Comics Collection Volume 1 for $24.55 (was $40) or the entire 1987 animated series on DVD for $26.59 (was $34). We've compiled a list of more TMNT comics, figures, and other collectibles below.

TMNT Collectibles and Merch

  • Hungry Hungry Hippos: TMNT Edition -- $25
  • The Last Ronin (Comic) -- $16.77 ($30)
  • The Last Ronin Funko Pop 4-Pack -- $60
  • TMNT 1987: The Complete Classic Series Collection (DVD) -- $26.59 ($34)
  • TMNT: The IDW Collection Volume 1 (Comic) -- $24.55 ($40)
  • Tubbz Donatello Rubber Duck -- $20
  • Turtle Power Ceramic Camper Mug -- $12
  • UNO: TMNT Edition -- $7
